page.title: 04A hedgerow near Lydden
page.content: The road was bounded on either side by banks and well established hedgerows containing many species of trees including holly,field maple and hazel. There were also hawthorn,sycamore,ash and oak. There was a great deal of ivy covering the trees.The plants on ome stretches of the banks were difficult to identify because they had been recently and ruthlessly cut back by a mechanical trimmer.Where the banks had not received this treatment,many plants could be seen.Among them were red campion,herb robert,some vetches,bracken,stinging nettles,white dead nettle,common hempnettle and cleavers.We also saw cuckoo pint and a stand of hogweed. We turned off the road into a rough track leading into Callow Wood.There were many wild strawberries on the banks here and some woody nightshade.
